title: Polyadenylated RNA Sampling
procedures: RNA extractionBacteria were grown in LB medium.At OD650=0.4 10 ml aliquots were rapidly mixed with an equal volume of 100% ethanol preequilibrated at -70 °C.Cells were pelleted for 10 min at 4,300 x g and 4 °C in the JA20 rotor of a Beckman centrifuge.Cells were resuspended in 1.5 ml 4 °C preequilibrated buffer 1.Mix with 1.5 ml of buffer 2 lysis buffer prewarmed at 95 °C.Cells were lysed for 2 min at 95 °C.RNAs were extracted twice at 65 °C with 3 ml of phenol saturated with water.RNAs were extracted once with chloroform at room temperature.RNAs were then precipitated with 2.5 volumes ethanol in the presence of 0.3 M NaCl, washed with 70% ethanol, and dissolved in water.RNA concentration was determined using a Nanovue.RT-PCR1 μg total RNA was incubated with 10 pmol CDSIII/3’PCR (5’-ATTCTAGAGGCCGAGGCGGCCGACATG-d(T)30NN-3’) and 10 pmol d’oligo SMART IV (5’-AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGTGGCCATTACGGCCGGG-3’) oligos (kit SMART cDNA, BD Biosciences) dissolved in water.Incubate for 2 min at 72 °C then 2 min in ice.Add 10 units PowerScript reverse transcriptase in 2 mM DTT, 2 mM dNTP, 1x buffer from the supplier).Incubate for 1 h at 42 °C. Amplify cDNA with 20 pmol 5’PCR Primer (5’-AAGCAGTGGTATCAACGCAGAGT-3’), 20 pmol CDSIII/3’PCR oligo, 0,2 mM dNTP, 2 μl Avantage 2 Polymerase Mix 1x. Incubate 1 min at 92 °C, then perform 22 cycles (15 sec at 95 °C, 6 min at 68 °C).PCR products were analysed on agarose 1% and purified according to their size if required.Cloning and sequencingDigest cDNAs with 200 units Sfi I for 3 h at 37 °C.Digest pDNR-LIB plasmid with 30 units Sfi I for 3 h at 37 °C.Purify the linear plasmid on agarose gel and elute the DNA by using the Jetsorb kit.Precipitate both cDNAs and plasmid and resuspend in water.

Ligate cDNAs and linear plasmid with 600 units T4 DNA ligase, 1 mM ATP, in recommended buffer for the night at 16 °C for 24 h.150 μl supercompetent Escherichia coli XLI Blue were transformed with 5 μl ligation mix.
